page.title: 17"My Day", by a farmer's son
page.content: "I have to get up between 5.30a.m. and 6.30a.m. to get the cows in for {milking,}then I come in at 7.15 a.m. I have to{feed the calves}twice a day in Winter. In the Spring I have to{bed {the heifers}daily. Usually we let the cows out in Spring and bring them in in late Autumn. They have to eat silage in Winter, but this Summer we are feeding them on silage and grass, although most summers we feed them on grass only. Last year we started to have three cuts of grass for silage, instead of two.In the Winter, just before dinner, I have to fill the barrow up with a{special feed of waste {sugar and maize.}I get the cows in from the fields at night at 5.00 p.m. for{evening milking,}and finish about 5.30.p.m." Ben and his 11 year old twin brother go to Normanton village school.
